project.name: kde
project.author: Caleb Tennis
project.description: The KDE project manages the qt and kde ebuilds in gentoo

longdescription.p: The kde project manages the qt ebuilds and kde ebuilds within gentoo. Currently this includes all kde applications. However, the kde applications will be put into function specific herds as the kde project can not maintain them properly as there are too many. Further many of the applications are not used by the kde maintainers. The project does however still support the teams that do manage these applications, and will ensure that they use the kde eclass where appropriate.

goals.p: The goal of the Gentoo KDE team is to provide working support for all packages supported by the KDE Project. We also support as many underlying packages as necessary in order to have a properly working KDE environment.

extraproject.name: Bleeding edge KDE
extraproject.p: We attempt to support running KDE directly from the CVS source utilizing a special set of ebuilds. They are available for download from here.

body.p: 3rd party applications install into /usr, NOT /usr/kde. This behavior can be changed by setting the KDEPREFIX variable to a different destination directory.

This allows different minor versions of KDE as well as the cvs version to be installed side by side in portage, and share applications. No two KDE versions should be aware of each other. You can safely merge in a new version of KDE without it unmerging an old version. Simply change which version you want to start in /etc/rc.conf, and the proper version of KDE should start.
The best way to get support with KDE related issues is to address your concerns in the forums. You may also submit a bug report to the KDE team at Gentoo's Bugzilla .
